content.text:
# Yuta Fujiwara

Japanese
| birth_date        =
| birth_place       = Sakai, Japan
| related to        =
| current series    = Super GT – GT300
| first year        = 2024
| current team      = Pacific Racing Team
| car number        = 9
| former teams      =
| starts            = 5
| wins              = 0
| podiums           = 0
| poles             = 0
| fastest laps      = 0
| best finish       = NC
| year              = 2024
| prev series       = Formula Regional Japanese ChampionshipF4 Japanese Championship
| prev series years = 20242022–2023
| titles            =
| title years       =
| awards            =
| award years       =

is a Japanese racing driver currently competing for Pacific Racing Team in the GT300 class of Super GT.
Early career
Formula 4
2022
In 2022, Fujiwara made his single-seater debut in the F4 Japanese Championship for Bionic Jack Racing. Despite a mid-season switch to Akiland Racing, Fujiwara only scored a best result of 11th at Autopolis and ended the season 22nd in the points with no points.
2023
In 2023, Fujiwara stayed with Akiland Racing for his sophomore season in the F4 Japanese Championship. In the season opening race at Fuji, Fujiwara finished 10th to score his maiden points in the championship. Following three score-less rounds, Fujiwara returned to the points at Sugo, by finishing sixth in race two. He finished 17th in the standings on nine points.
2024
Fujiwara returned to Akiland Racing to compete in the first round of the newly-created F110 Cup at Okayama. He took both poles, fastest laps and wins to score maximum points from the two races.
Formula Regional
In the final round of the 2024 Formula Regional Japanese Championship at Fuji Speedway, Fujiwara made his Formula Regional debut, joining Rn-sports alongside Masayuki Ueda. Fujiwara finished sixth on debut and scored his first top-five in race two.
Drifting career
Alongside his rookie campaign in Super GT, Fujiwara made his D1GP Lights debut and took his first solo-run win at the third round of the season.
Super GT
2024
After passing the pre-season rookie test, Fujiwara was announced to be joining Pacific Racing Team as its third driver alongside Ryohei Sakaguchi and Yusuke Tomibayashi. On his debut at Fuji, Fujiwara finished 12th, which would be his best result of the season.
2025
Ahead of the 2025 season, it was announced that Fujiwara would return to Super GT as Pacific Racing Team's third driver.
